DETALHAMENTO-DE-CARTA-MAPA-OU-SIMILAR.TECNICA-UTILIZADA: O modelo utiliza álgebra de mapas para produzir o mapa de destaque territorial com índices variando entre 1 (baixo) e 10 (alto).
DETALHAMENTO-DE-CARTA-MAPA-OU-SIMILAR.FINALIDADE: Método para mapear e qualificar o impacto social dos Programas de Pós-Graduação (PPG) na área de Ciências Ambientais da Coordenação de Aperfeiçoamento de Pessoal de Nível Superior (CAPES)

AUTORES.NOME-COMPLETO-DO-AUTOR: Washington de Jesus Sant?Anna da Franca Rocha

SETORES-DE-ATIVIDADE.SETOR-DE-ATIVIDADE-1: Educação

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS:
Modelo consistiu na integração espacial de três componentes: o índice de vulnerabilidade socioeconômica (infraestrutura, capital humano, renda e trabalho); o índice de hemerobia (grau de antropização no uso e na 
ocupação do solo); e a densidade geográfica dos PPG. O modelo utiliza álgebra de mapas para produzir o mapa de destaque territorial com índices variando entre 1 (baixo) e 10 (alto). A validação ocorreu na avaliação quadrienal 2017, quando consultores da CAPES utilizaram o mapa de destaque territorial 
para interpretar qualitativamente a inserção social dos PPG frente às vulnerabilidades socioeconômicas e ambientais regionais.
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES:
This article proposes a method to map and qualify the social insertion of Postgraduate Programs in CAPES? Environmental Sciences area. The model was built based on the spatial integration of three key components: the socioeconomic vulnerability index (infrastructure, human capital, income and 
labor), the hemeroby index (land use and occupation), and the Postgraduate Programs? geographic density. The solution uses map algebra to output the Geographic Highlights, which indexes ranging from 1 (low) to 10 (high)..The validation of the model occurred with the 2017 quadrennial evaluation, 
when Geographic Highlights map supported CAPES consultants to qualitatively interpret the social insertion of Postgraduate Programs in the face of regional socioeconomic and environmental vulnerabilities. Other applications envisaged are: identification of priority areas for new courses, resource allocation (human and financial), encouraging the creation of collaborative networks, and, finally, 
analysis of former students? professional insertion.

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS:
Consejo Nacional de Ciencia y Tecnología
Presente.

?La Responsabilidad Social Universitaria (RSU), viene a ser el elemento integrador con la sociedad, donde se reflejan indicadores éticos de la filosofía de la gestión para la intervención de factores de naturaleza legal, ético, moral y ambiental?, propone transformar a la Universidad y su entorno social en laboratorios para aprender, enseñar, investigar e innovar (Aguirre et al. 18).

Bajo las premisas de la Responsabilidad Social Universitaria, la presente se extiende por la Lic. en C. A. Teresa Ruiz Cruz que actualmente concluyó el segundo semestre y es alumna regular de la Maestría en Estudios Sustentables Regionales y Metropolitanos que ofrece la Universidad Autónoma del Estado de México (UAEMex.), bajo el Área de Conocimiento de Responsabilidad Social y Desarrollo Sustentable. Como parte del proceso académico, el Trabajo Terminal de Grado que se realiza se denomina: Manual de responsabilidad social universitaria: campus responsable en la maestría en estudios sustentables regionales y metropolitanos, 2012-2014.

La RSU se considera como una estrategia orientada a lograr ciudadanos propios y honestos dentro de las instalaciones universitarias, personas comprometidas con la sociedad para mejorar la calidad de vida propia y la de la ciudadanía con la aplicación de sus conocimientos científicos con responsabilidad y ética (Aguirre et al. 2012:11-13, 18).

En la búsqueda de ampliar los conocimientos para el proyecto, se genera el acercamiento con la Pontificia Universidad Católica de Paraná - PUCPR, en su programa académico Posgrado en Gestión Urbana impartido en la Escuela de Arquitectura y Diseño. Con quien ya se ha establecido la aceptación como alumno del programa académico a partir del 5 de Agosto del 2013 y hasta el 31 de Diciembre del 2013.

La aceptación al programa de Posgrado en Gestión Urbana se genera para cursar las materias:

?	Nucleo de Gestão e Políticas Públicas
?	Nucleo de Ecossocioe

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES:
The current socio-economic model, considered to be an excluded development and based on an 
economic rationale of utilitarian-consumerist logic, is in crisis. Even with efforts towards 
sustainable development, climate change and social disparities continue to worsen, causing 
society to seek post-developmental ways. The urban environment concentrates on complex 
socio-environmental problems, one of which is the growing housing deficit. In Brazil, this 
deficit stems from segregating patterns that need new approaches that include sustainability in 
its planning, as recommended by the SDG 11. To contribute to changing this reality, this study 
aimed to identify, in the face of movements around slow cities and of ecovillages, which are 
still embryonic and on a small scale of reproduction, the potential of Morretes-PR for the 
inclusion of bioconstruction as an alternative in popular housing. From the research, of 
exploratory character and qualitative bias, the urgency for social housing was identified in the
municipality, but also the openness and possibility for a more sustainable urban planning. In 
addition to bioconstruction, it was sought to use other characteristics of slow cities and 
ecovillages, such as planning aimed at socioenvironmental well-being, including in the house's 
surroundings such as community gardens and ecological sewage treatment systems. Still, 
political, and constructive factors that favor the use of bioconstruction in the municipality's 
housing programs were found, such as legislation, available labor, and interest by the city in 
environmental conservation projects, thus demonstrating its potential for the development of a 
more sustainable city.

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES:
ESG concept have been progressively gaining prominence in the business world, 
encompassing not only major corporations but also small and medium-sized 
enterprises. This trend is driven by a constant growth of external pressures from 
stakeholders, urging for more sustainable products, processes, and services. 
However, within this context, larger companies, usually haven broader structures and 
greater resource availability, been capable of understanding, measuring, and defining 
strategies and actions to be implemented towards sustainability. On the other hand, 
smaller and medium-sized enterprises, often family-owned and resource-constrained, 
find themselves out of this context, struggling to grasp the concepts and impacts that 
ESG can bring to their businesses. The present study aims to contribute by providing 
to small and medium-sized business owners elements that enhance their 
understanding, awareness, and consciousness not only of the ESG framework itself 
but also of the impacts that the adoption or non-adoption of ESG practices can have 
on their businesses in the short, medium, and long term. With the objective of assisting 
entrepreneurs in this understanding, the following specific objectives were formulated: 
a) assess the degree of ESG practice adoption in SMEs that belong to the supply chain 
of the Brazilian automotive industry; and b) evaluate how the adoption of ESG practices 
can impact economic outcomes, business performance, and corporate image from the 
entrepreneur's perspective. To achieve this, an exploratory research methodology was 
applied with a mixed descriptive approach (qualitative and quantitative), combining 
pre-selected variables based on literature, semi-structured in-person or online 
interviews, and analysis of collected data in a quantitative-qualitative manner. As a 
result, it was observed that the average degree of ESG practice adoption was 88%, 
with 89% in the governance pillar and 87% in the e

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: Quality of Life (QL), as a collective phenomenon internalized in urban contexts, has relevant meaning and influence in the formulation of public policies to guide state actions, in order to provide and ensure minimum conditions for a dignified life. In this sense, some cities stand out, among them Curitiba. Even though it is a collective phenomenon, the quality of life can be lived and felt with different connotations by different social groups. In recent decades, women have made progress in the social, economic and political spheres, gaining spaces and rights that were once male-only, which does not imply that women's quality of life has improved at the same rate. From subjection in the private area to the role of sociopolitical subject in the public space, it is revealed the need to bring the female subject matter to the debate in urban management. Women not only represent the growing and relevant population majority, but also, in a daily basis, face complexities and contradictions experienced in the urban space and in the political agenda, for determinant symbolic and cultural issues that still personify traces of patriarchal and capitalist society. Therefore, the field of public policies for QL in the urban space demands theoretical and empirical studies, which are still incipient in the city of Curitiba and other cities of different national and international contexts, especially those that incorporate the theme of QL and Good Living (GL) as basis for the decision making process and implementation of public policies, which aim at reducing the sociopolitical and economic inequalities still strongly present in different women?s living spaces. Accordingly, the aim of this study is to analyze the history of public policies for women, focusing on the promotion of urban quality of life and good living in Curitiba between 1988 and 2018. In the field of practice, this research proves to be innovative for QL because it approaches the issue of women and their constructio

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES:
Regardless of the brazilian and global crisis due to the COVID-19 pandemic, the 
automotive industry is advancing through new and significant global renewals, which 
arise at the heart of some directions of the segment, especially with regard to 
electrification and vehicular hybridization, as an adaptive response to ongoing 
environmental issues. Automakers and automotive dealerships show concerns about 
these global megatrends that should impact the sector and are emphatic, especially 
regarding the rapid growth of solutions and business proposals that involve changing 
consumer behavior, especially regarding the sustainability aspect of the product, as 
well as the new concept of vehicle use, rather than the purchase of the good. In 
addition, the legal regulatory framework that the segment is subject, requiring the 
evolution of environmental protection, is still to be highlighted. Thus, the following 
research problem is evidenced: What are the necessary adaptations in the governance 
process of the automotive production chain, to ensure its resilience in the face of new 
market demands, considering electrification and vehicular hybridization, as an 
adaptive response to current environmental issues? The planet does not have the 
capacity to support current consumption patterns, which seems essential to seek 
sustainability at all levels, especially in services and in production and transformation 
processes. Aligned with this need, this project aims to establish governance guidelines 
of the sustainable automotive chain south of Brazil in order to provide more competitive 
conditions in the face of new challenges of a market that is a determinant of 
environmental conditioning. To this end, an in-depth study will be carried out in 
consolidated automotive markets, such as Germany, the United States and Japan, 
which has demonstrated over the last few years greater attention to environmental 
aspects within the automotive chain, and which

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: This research focuses on answering two central questions: Is landscape codesign feasible among differentiated territorial actors? and what are the dominant and emerging socio-spatial representations of landscapes in territories with high biodiversity? It is hypothesised that territorial actors (rural communities, Mapuche, public and private sector) could present differences in their mental models and socio-spatial representations that would condition the processes of spatial production and the current landscape configurations. Codesign in this process would be a feasible practice only among groups that share collective representations, in which certain landscape representations could become hegemonic over time through material and symbolic mechanisms, as well as emerging landscape representations that claim new meanings about landscapes, trying to differentiate themselves from the current structures and mechanisms of domination. Thus, the General Objective is to analyse mental models and socio-spatial representations of current landscapes to project the possibilities for codesign of landscapes by culturally differentiated actors. This is diachronic research located in the fragmented North Patagonian landscapes of southern Chile in the commune of Panguipulli. It is a phenomenological and transdisciplinary research as it assembles theoretical and methodological contributions from different disciplines (geography, anthropology, political science, humanities) with the lived realities of the actors themselves. In these territories, we identify spaces in conflict over use and ownership between state agents, businessmen, rural and Mapuche communities, which respond to the different appropriations of the landscape through mechanisms related to socio-spatial representations. It is framed temporally in the period of neoliberalisation of the country, developed from 1973 to the present, with the focus on current configurations and possible projections on the codesign of the lan

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Esta pesquisa busca caracterizar o contexto social e coletivo do sistema de atividade de artesanato da Feira do Largo da Ordem em Curitiba analisando como a Ecossocioeconomia Urbana repercute nas práticas de artesanato a partir uma perspectiva sociocultural e histórica. A análise dos sistemas de atividades de artesanato na Feira de Arte e Artesanato do Largo da Ordem foi realizada a partir da observação direta das atividades vinculadas à prática, com o uso de filmagens, gravações e entrevistas sobre as atividades dos artesãos, além da autoconfrontação simples, para instigar os participantes a refletir sobre a atividade realizada. Há a apresentação e análise de dados, com a apresentação da Feira do Largo da Ordem e a descrição dos sistemas de atividade a partir da pesquisa realizada com os artesãos e a constituição do sistema de artesanato da feira do Largo da Ordem. Em seguida há a discussão e são apresentadas as conclusões da pesquisa. Conclui-se que a mesma forma como acontece na teoria da atividade a ecossocioeconomia se dá no mundo da vida e do trabalho onde problemas e suas soluções acontecem. É também pensada a partir das experimentações, das complexidades do cotidiano, das contradições inerentes à mudança paradigmática que se deseja, aqui, principalmente quando se pensa nas limitações do utilitarismo econômico e em novas racionalidades.

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: The yerba mate chain, of great historical and economic importance for the country, is one of the sectors that presents challenges in relation to sustainability, thought of its triple base concept (social, economic and environmental), especially when the focus is on the producers, mainly the small and medium ones and their perceptions of ecosocioeconomics. Therefore, the following problem is identified: the search for business sustainability in the field advances for certain larger-scale crops and, consequently, greater economic interest, such as coffee and tea, which have their own consolidated sustainability certification processes. However, this is not the case in the yerba mate sector. This study aims to evaluate the sustainability of a stratum of this chain, based on the relationship between the Ervateira São Mateus industry and the producers / suppliers of mate in the region of São Mateus do Sul - PR., considering the existing certification processes such as Fairtrade, Rainforest Alliance and UTZ. The used method is the case study through a data collection script, which uses a semistructured questionnaire, supported by systematized bibliographic research of the sustainable production chain and the state of the art of sustainable certification in coffee and tea production. As main results, we describe the socioeconomic process that mediates the cultivation and marketing of yerba mate among producers and the beginning of industrialization in one of the region's largest Ervateiras and identifies some ways for possible sustainable certifications of these producers, its barriers and its advantages. The main conclusions reached by this study is that the producers of yerba mate in this region are completely unaware of such certifications, lacking information and external support. However, these producers wish to adequate their properties in view of possible economic and environmental gains. It would be possible to adopt social and environmental certifications to promo

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: The intense debate about the socioenvironmental crisis has mobilized increasing attention throughout the world. This is because it is not only an ecological calamity or an imbalance of the current economic paradigm, but of its foundations. In an attempt to adapt today's business models to the challenges of sustainability, companies arise with purpose, such as companies B. The present study aims to analyze the companies with purpose, verifying how they can contribute to the The emergence of new socio-environmentally inclusive economies. As a way to qualify these experiences, the ecosocioeconomies matrix of organizations presents itself as a theoretical-methodological framework suitable for rethinking the current business management that considering the social consequences and environmental costs in the economic actions. For this, an exploratory-descriptive research of qualitative nature was performed, using as methods the bibliographic-documental research and content analysis. The study has five companies with socio-environmental purpose of the B movement in Brazil, companies that, without fail to act on the market logic, incorporate the social and environmental impacts in their business model. As a result, by recharacterizing B companies, the perspective of eco socioeconomics were partially met, demonstrating that companies are in the process of transience of corporations with social and environmental practices, to socially responsible businesses. What one wants to achieve with transience is the conception of a company that assumes the ecosocioeconomic, purpose, that synergy is created between these three dimensions, thus expanding the performance and expanding the idea of gain, which suggests that there are no losers.

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: Development was synonymous of economic growth until the 1960s, when discussions and the emergence of new development paradigms such as eco-development and sustainable development emerged. However, the evolution of the theme did not contribute to the reduction of inequalities between countries considered ?central? - pioneers in the process of urbanization and industrialization - and peripheral countries - considered late industrialization - perpetuating concerns about underdevelopment and income imbalances and quality of life, which occurs worldwide. Thus, the end of the 20th century seems to have shown the limits of development as a synonym for growth, due to the frequent natural catastrophes and the depletion of resources. It is in line with the need for development to be associated with human development and the preservation of ecosystems. This awareness was constituted and materialized at the United Nations Conference on Environment and Development, held in June 1992 in Rio de Janeiro; known as Rio 92, the conference brought together more than 100 heads of state to discuss how to guarantee future generations the right to sustainable development. In September 2000, world leaders met again, this time at United Nations headquarters in New York, to adopt the UN Millennium Declaration. This document guided the actions of the international community in the following three years and started the global consultation process for the construction of a set of universal sustainable development objectives, the Millennium Development Goals (MDGs), which were in force until 2015. The continuity of the MDGs defined, in 2015, the 17 Sustainable Development Goals (SDGs), consisting of 169 goals that instigate global actions to be implemented by 2030. These new global guidelines brought the challenge of measuring and communicating the actions developed in favor of socio-environmental defense. Taking this scenario as a reference, this work sought to identify SDG indicators capable of

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: Regional development results from the combination and calibration of temporal / historical variables, which give a type and rhythm of development with a spatial or geographic variable, being this, the territory or the region where it occurs. The aim is regional development guided by sustainable principles and for this to happen, careful and adequate consideration of the dimensions of sustainability is necessary, based on an integrated and integrative systemic vision. The following study aims to analyze the tourism potential of Pouso Redondo, in the state of Santa Catarina, considering its implications for Sustainable Regional Development. To this end, it aims to propose alternatives for tourism development in the municipality, pointing out natural attractions with the potential to do so. It is applied research. Regarding the approach to the problem, it is qualitative and its objectives are exploratory. It adopts as methodological procedures: bibliographic research, documentary research, interviews and participant observation, in addition to an analytical matrix derived from the work of Ignacy Sachs. The results point to the existence of natural attractions with the potential for sustainable tourist use in the defined region. However, the challenges range from not knowing and / or not considering these potentialities, to the non-existence of public policies and / or private or community initiatives so that this can become a reality. A map was created that aims to demonstrate the results and that can be used to think about future tourist routes. It is part of the line of research Socioeconomic Dynamics in the Territory of the Postgraduate Program in Regional Development - PPGDR of the Regional University of Blumenau - FURB.

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES:
The current socio-economic model, considered to be an excluded development and based on an 
economic rationale of utilitarian-consumerist logic, is in crisis. Even with efforts towards 
sustainable development, climate change and social disparities continue to worsen, causing 
society to seek post-developmental ways. The urban environment concentrates on complex 
socio-environmental problems, one of which is the growing housing deficit. In Brazil, this 
deficit stems from segregating patterns that need new approaches that include sustainability in 
its planning, as recommended by the SDG 11. To contribute to changing this reality, this study 
aimed to identify, in the face of movements around slow cities and of ecovillages, which are 
still embryonic and on a small scale of reproduction, the potential of Morretes-PR for the 
inclusion of bioconstruction as an alternative in popular housing. From the research, of 
exploratory character and qualitative bias, the urgency for social housing was identified in the
municipality, but also the openness and possibility for a more sustainable urban planning. In 
addition to bioconstruction, it was sought to use other characteristics of slow cities and 
ecovillages, such as planning aimed at socioenvironmental well-being, including in the house's 
surroundings such as community gardens and ecological sewage treatment systems. Still, 
political, and constructive factors that favor the use of bioconstruction in the municipality's 
housing programs were found, such as legislation, available labor, and interest by the city in 
environmental conservation projects, thus demonstrating its potential for the development of a 
more sustainable city.

DADOS-BASICOS-DA-PARTICIPACAO-EM-BANCA-D.TITULO-INGLES: Strategic plan to enhance the environmental and economic performance of a large Brazilian financial institution

SETORES-DE-ATIVIDADE.SETOR-DE-ATIVIDADE-1: Serviços de escritório, de apoio administrativo e outros serviços prestados às empresas

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: As intermediaries of resources between different economic agents, financial institutions play an important role in directing capital to projects and activities that contribute to corporate sustainability, especially those that have positive environmental impacts. In this sense, the financial sector, as an intermediary of economic activity, has a high power of induction, that is, it has the capacity to encourage good practices both in its own internal environment, as a company, and externally, as a financing agent, promoting improvements in environmental performance of its customers, with a positive impact on society as a whole. Therefore, the objective of this dissertation is to elaborate a strategic plan to increase the environmental and economic performance of a large Brazilian financial institution, located in the city of Maringá/PR, aligned with the SDGs guidelines and ESG dimensions. The specific objectives are: i) to characterize the profile of the companies selected for this study; ii) characterize the types and volume of credit used by customers; iii) characterize the environmental performance of the studied companies; and iv) propose strategies for diversifying and expanding business between the financial institution and customers who do not have it as their main banking partner. This is a documentary, exploratory and descriptive research. The work fits into at least five SDGs of the 2030 Agenda, which are the most relevant for the financial sector: quality education (4); gender equality (5); decent work and economic growth (8); industry, innovation and infrastructure (9); and global climate change (13). The relationship between the environmental performance of 27 medium and large companies in the region of Maringá/PR, with annual revenues between R$ 30 million and R$ 800 million, was analyzed. It was found that most of the analyzed companies carry out corporate sustainability actions, having environmental policies with guidelines present in their planning

C.;Cioce Sampaio, C. A.;Sampaio Cioce, Carlos A.;C. Sampaio, C. A.;Cioce S., C. A.;SAMPAIO, CARLOS;CIOCE SAMPAIO, C. A.;CIOCE SAMPAIO, Carlos Aleberto

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: The Brazilian economic model is punctuated by criticism since it does not respond to the environmental anxieties of society. In this line with this demand, on September 20, 2017, the Federal Senate approved a provisional measure authorizing the IBGE (Brazilian Institute of Geography and Statistics) to calculate the Green GDP. Green GDP is an indicator made to monitor the ways of introducing the losses generated by the degradation or exhaustion of natural resources, arising from industrial activity. Therefore, the green GDP enters as a way of equalizing the binomial industrial productivity & use of natural resources. In this context, this thesis aims to analyze the efficiency of the calculation of the green GDP, to define the environmental sustainability of the metalworking and textile sectors in Santa Catarina. The justification for the selection of these sectors is bay way as two activities of great representativeness in the Santa Catarina economy. The theoretical justification falls in the effort of interdisciplinary integration of theories of regional development, territorial planning and the resilience of socioecological systems in the perspective of the calculation of the Green GDP. Thus, it is intended to demonstrate how the Green GDP can be used to measure the sustainability potential of the industrial product. The methodology of the research is descriptive exploratory character and the objective is quali-quanti in the process of data collection. To this end, the gap between the Green GDP and the industrial product was analyzed based on the possibility that if the Green GDP is equal to the Industrial GDP, there is no loss of sustainability. If the Green GDP is less than Industrial GDP, it implies that industrial activity is losing its sustainability. As a result, it was verified that, in Santa Catarina, the textile sector presents a potential of greater sustainability than the metal-mechanic sector.However, since the Green GDP of both sectors is lower than th

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES:
Urban housing constitutes itself as a scenery of profound inequality and
disparity. The fundamental right to a home inserted in the article 6 of the 1988 Federal
Constitution, interpreted in light of the principle of the dignity of the human person
comprises the physical housing space added to the access to urban infrastructure. The
?Minha Casa Minha Vida? program (PMCMV), a housing policy developed in Brazil
from 2009 onwards, offers to meet the social housing demand. Housing verticalization
is a contemporary urban trend which gives origin to condominiums, spaces that
congregate common and individual environments. Good living, a concept that is open
and in construction, has its origins in Latin America and presents itself as an alternative
to the current development, based on the appreciation of the human being, of nature
and the coexistence relations and interactions in society through interculturalism. In
this context, the main objective of this research was to analyze the attendance to the
fundamental right to housing and good living of the families contemplated with housing
in vertical condominiums built within the ?Minha Casa Minha Vida? program (PMCMV)
in the city of Curitiba, Paraná. The objectives specified were a) to study the urban
environment, the city and the current legal regulation, as well as the PMCMV as a
contemporary housing policy, b) to understand the fundamental right to housing under
the perspective of the dignity of the human person, c) to address the verticalization
process and the legal configurations of vertical condominiums, d) to ponder on good
living in face of our current society and e) to know the parameters of living and
coexistence in a popular vertical condominium consolidated and built by the PMCMV
program in Curitiba, considering the subjective, intersubjective, social and
environmental aspects existent. A qualitative research of exploratory character was
conducted with an interdisciplinary focus. Adopted a

DADOS-BASICOS-DA-PARTICIPACAO-EM-BANCA-D.TITULO: Habitação popular, tempo e (i)mobilidade urbana na (in)justiça ambiental: da Vila Parolin ao bairro Ganchinho, Curitiba/PR
DADOS-BASICOS-DA-PARTICIPACAO-EM-BANCA-D.TITULO-INGLES: The dynamics of (im)mobility are manifested in environmental (in)justice in the cohousing, focusing on resettlement places for low-income population

PARTICIPANTE-BANCA.NOME-PARA-CITACAO-DO-PARTICIPANTE-DA-BAN: SAMPAIO, Carlos Alberto Cioce;Sampaio, Carlos Alberto Cioce;Cioce Sampaio,;Cioce Sampaio, Carlos;Sampaio, Carlos Cioce;Sampaio, C. A. C.;Cioce Sampaio, C. A.;Sampaio Cioce, Carlos A.;C. Sampaio, C. A.;Cioce S., C. A.;SAMPAIO, CARLOS;CIOCE SAMPAIO, C. A.;CIOCE SAMPAIO, Carlos Aleberto

SETORES-DE-ATIVIDADE.SETOR-DE-ATIVIDADE-1: Administração pública, defesa e seguridade social

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES:
This research seeks to understand how the dynamics of time and urban
(im)mobility are manifested in environmental (in)justice, in the context of popular
housing, focusing on resettlement places for low-income population, contributing to the
deepening of the discussion of urban socio-environmental issues. An exploratory,
qualitative research was developed, using the theoretical-documentary reference, the
interview and the intensive direct observation as techniques of data collection. The
concrete problem of the case study is the Residencial Parque Iguaçu III, located in the
neighborhood Ganchinho, in Curitiba ? Paraná, where families were relocated from
Vila Parolin, an irregular occupation in an area of socio-environmental vulnerability. It
is defended the thesis that the conditions of urban mobility in the context of popular
housing do not allow a real condition of urbanity, relegating to the residents a
subordinate condition in the scope of the right to the city. These conditions are
complementary to other fundamental functions such as housing, mainly. It is evident
that urban mobility can be a facilitating condition for environmental justice, and without
it, resettlement does not allow the real conditions of inclusion and environmental justice
due to the difficulty of access to goods, services and equipment for individual and
collective development, limiting the time and the capacity of accomplishment of these
individuals.

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES:
The Sustainability Assessment (SA) is a process by which the implications of a
sustainability initiative are evaluated. Approaching the theme from the perspective of
environmental management systems contributes to identifying and understanding the
gaps that still remain in this field of knowledge. One of the SA?s tools includes the
sustainability indicator system ? a tool also used in environmental management
processes. It?s function is to establish an overall view that requires a process that
assesses results against established goals, providing the stakeholders with adequate
follow-up conditions and supporting the decision making process. An adequate
indicator system allows the stakeholders to wear the lenses of sustainability, thus
favoring legitimate changes in the organization. To this end, the correct framing of the
indicators is required (framework) so that sustainability can be captured in an
integrated manner. This research arose from the knowledge gap regarding the
efficiency of maintaining a consolidated indicator system at universities. It weaves the
relationship between SA and environmental management at these institutions, with
emphasis being placed on the principles and tools that direct these fields, and
proposes procedures for applying the indicator system in a framework. The central
question of the thesis is: how does the Sustainability Assessment approach contribute
to the management processes at universities? The aim is to elaborate an indicator
system for the Sustainability Assessment at universities from the perspective of
environmental management processes at these locations, and to structure them into a
management framework that favors its use. The research was based on theoretical
sampling procedures; guiding data collection are analytical questions such as question
formulation, the analytical mechanism used to open the line of inquiry and to direct
sampling, and comparisons, used to stimulate thought about category pr

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: This thesis aims to analyze the contradictions, limits, advances, and possibilities of the National Solid Waste Policy (PNRS/2010) and its interface with the socio-productive inclusion of recyclable material collectors in municipalities in the State of Mato Grosso. From the enforcement of PNRS, Federal Law 12.305/2010, the implementation of Integrated Solid Waste Management Plans and Planning is a municipal responsibility. The legislator assigned to municipal entities, as a priority, the contracting of self-managed enterprises of recyclable material collectors, formed by low-income people, for the system of collection, processing, and commercialization of recyclable solid waste, aiming at socio-productive inclusion and economic emancipation of these workers. This study problematizes: What are the contradictions, limits, advances, and possibilities of the National Solid Waste Policy (PNRS/2010) implemented in municipalities in the State of Mato Grosso in the socio-productive inclusion of recyclable material collectors? This thesis is a descriptive study with a qualitative approach. Data collection through literature and documentary review, field research with an in-depth interview and finally the content analysis technique was used. It was evidenced that the participation of recyclable material collectors in the integrated solid waste management system contributes to reducing environmental impacts, social inequalities and is economically viable as it generates income and promotes the satisfaction of human needs. Despite this, there are limitations, arising mostly from the lack of resources destined for investments in integrated solid waste management policies, especially to operate selective collection with the participation of collectors, regarding the structure of both municipalities and associations and cooperatives, the precariousness of physical facilities, capital resources, technology, and excessive state bureaucracy in the application of the legal framework w

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES:
Regardless of the brazilian and global crisis due to the COVID-19 pandemic, the 
automotive industry is advancing through new and significant global renewals, which 
arise at the heart of some directions of the segment, especially with regard to 
electrification and vehicular hybridization, as an adaptive response to ongoing 
environmental issues. Automakers and automotive dealerships show concerns about 
these global megatrends that should impact the sector and are emphatic, especially 
regarding the rapid growth of solutions and business proposals that involve changing 
consumer behavior, especially regarding the sustainability aspect of the product, as 
well as the new concept of vehicle use, rather than the purchase of the good. In 
addition, the legal regulatory framework that the segment is subject, requiring the 
evolution of environmental protection, is still to be highlighted. Thus, the following 
research problem is evidenced: What are the necessary adaptations in the governance 
process of the automotive production chain, to ensure its resilience in the face of new 
market demands, considering electrification and vehicular hybridization, as an 
adaptive response to current environmental issues? The planet does not have the 
capacity to support current consumption patterns, which seems essential to seek 
sustainability at all levels, especially in services and in production and transformation 
processes. Aligned with this need, this project aims to establish governance guidelines 
of the sustainable automotive chain south of Brazil in order to provide more competitive 
conditions in the face of new challenges of a market that is a determinant of 
environmental conditioning. To this end, an in-depth study will be carried out in 
consolidated automotive markets, such as Germany, the United States and Japan, 
which has demonstrated over the last few years greater attention to environmental 
aspects within the automotive chain, and which

DADOS-BASICOS-DA-PARTICIPACAO-EM-BANCA-D.TITULO: Comunicação publicitária e desenvolvimento do turismo: estudo comparativo da imagem de destinos com diferentes modelos sociopolíticos
DADOS-BASICOS-DA-PARTICIPACAO-EM-BANCA-D.TITULO-INGLES: Advertising communication and tourism developmente: comparative study of the image of destinations with different sociopolitical models

SETORES-DE-ATIVIDADE.SETOR-DE-ATIVIDADE-1: Agências de viagens, operadores turísticos e serviços de reservas

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: The present project seeks to understand the relationship between the advertising communication of the destination image and the sociopolitical model of the territories, analyzing its implications for the development of tourism. The argument used seeks to determine whether the advertising communication of the image of the tourist destination is different according to the sociopolitical model of the territory, and reflects on the subject from a comparative study of three tourist destinations: United States, Brazil and Cuba. In this sense, the analysis here focuses on identifying the main tourist attributes involved in the hegemonic models in the scientific literature of advertising communication and destination image; present the projected image of tourist destinations with different sociopolitical models and analyze the possible relationships between sociopolitical models of territories and the projected image of tourist destinations. The corpus of analysis consists of the images published on the Instagram profile. Given these purposes, and through research methods and procedures that included a bibliometric survey, literature review, content analysis and document analysis, it was possible to understand how advertising communication projects the image of tourist destinations. It was found that destinations adopt a traditional and similar perspective in advertising communication, in which the presentation of attributes is the main objective, regardless of the sociopolitical model of the territory. This finding contrasts with the development of tourism in each of the territories, which is distinguished according to the sociopolitical model. While on the one hand there is an uneven tourism development, with spatial, sectoral, temporal and social implications, on the other hand there is a development based on an endogenous approach, with a community and cooperative nature.

SETORES-DE-ATIVIDADE.SETOR-DE-ATIVIDADE-1: Atividades ligadas ao patrimônio cultural e ambiental

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS:
The production of agricultural commodities has been associated with the loss of native 
vegetation land cover and multiple environmental problems such as soil erosion and loss of 
biodiversity. To reverse this trend, it is necessary to promote sustainable management of rural 
landscapes, avoiding the loss of native vegetation and promoting the role of important 
ecosystem services (e.g., provision, regulation and recreation) in order to ensure that these are 
available for present and future generations. This thesis explores why, where and how there is 
scope for fostering synergies between recreation and food provision services associated with 
native vegetation land covers as an alternative to land use intensification in Brazil. The goal of 
this work is to identify key conditions for different tourism modalities to add to the material 
and immaterial values associated with the maintenance of standing native vegetation by 
fostering Brazilian sociobiodiversity productive chains. Each chapter of the dissertation aims 
to answer why, where and how to implement tourism modalities (community-based tourism 
CBT, ecotourism and agritourism) aligned with the use of biodiversity, including a variety of 
non-timber forest products (NTFPs) that are collected using skills and knowledge of traditional 
communities. Multiscale and interdisciplinary research approaches involving environmental 
sciences and applied social sciences were used for conducting literature review, data collection, 
spatially explicit modeling and case study analysis to support the results presented in five 
chapters. After the introduction and contextualization of the problem, chapter 2 shows that there 
are CBT, ecotourism and agritourism initiatives that already add value to sociobiodiversity
productive chains, but those are often at the local scale. Chapters 3, 4 and 5 explore, at the 
national scale, which areas have the biophysical and cultural potential to upscale good practic

DADOS-BASICOS-DA-PARTICIPACAO-EM-BANCA-D.TITULO: Governança e Meio Ambiente: energia fotovoltaica e as políticas de eficiência energética para o desenvolvimento sustentável na UniEvangélica
DADOS-BASICOS-DA-PARTICIPACAO-EM-BANCA-D.TITULO-INGLES: Governança e Meio Ambiente: energia fotovoltaica e as políticas de eficiência energética para o desenvolvimento sustentável na UniEvangelica

SETORES-DE-ATIVIDADE.SETOR-DE-ATIVIDADE-1: Serviços de escritório, de apoio administrativo e outros serviços prestados às empresas

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS:
Esta pesquisa tem o objetivo geral de analisar os processos históricos, econômicos, 
administrativos e ambientais que envolvem a gestão organizacional e ambiental da 
Usina Fotovoltaica da Universidade Evangélica de Goiás. Os objetivos específicos 
incluem investigar as políticas desenvolvimentistas no Brasil e sua articulação com o 
avanço da produção energética, analisar a imprensa brasileira e os periódicos de 
maior circulação na temática das energias renováveis e a energia fotovoltaica, estudar 
os processos de instalação e de gestão da Usina Fotovoltaica na UniEVANGÉLICA e 
sua associação às políticas de governança e sustentabilidade, e desenvolver um 
projeto de gestão organizacional e ambiental para a Associação Educativa Evangélica 
focado na ampliação e explícita aderência aos ODS da Agenda 2030. A pesquisa se 
fundamenta nos estudos interdisciplinares e no diálogo entre diferentes áreas do 
conhecimento, e nos procedimentos teórico-metodológicos nas pressuposições das 
ciências ambientais. Os capítulos são compostos por artigos publicados em periódicos 
indexados, estudos de casos e análises descritivas da estrutura organizacional da 
Usina Fotovoltaica da UniEVANGÉLICA e de eficiência energética. O quarto capítulo 
aborda a adequação da Responsabilidade Social da IES à Agenda 2030 e propõe 
medidas de ampliação de atuação para sua internalização.
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES:
This work aims to generally analyze the historical, economic, administrative and 
environmental processes for organizational and environmental management, 
encompassing the case of the Photovoltaic Plant of the Evangelical University of Goiás 
? UniEVANGÉLICA. The specific objectives are: to investigate the development 
policies in Brazil and their articulation with the advancement of energy production 
between the 1950s and 1980s; to analyze the discussions made by the Brazilian press 
regarding renewable energies in Brazil and the approach of photovoltaic energy in the 
second half of the twentieth century and the first decade of the twenty-first century; to 
study the installation and management processes of the Photovoltaic Plant and its 
association with organizational and sustainability management policies; to develop an 
organizational and environmental management project that incorporates the SDGs of 
the 2030 Agenda in the Social Responsibility of UniEVANGÉLICA. For this, 
interdisciplinary studies, dialogue between different areas of knowledge, documentary 
sources, qualitative methods and descriptive analyses will be employed. The results 
will be published in indexed articles.

SETORES-DE-ATIVIDADE.SETOR-DE-ATIVIDADE-1: Serviços de escritório, de apoio administrativo e outros serviços prestados às empresas

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: O intenso debate a respeito da crise socioambiental tem mobilizado atenção crescente em todo o mundo. Isso ocorre pois não se trata somente de uma calamidade ecológica ou um desequilíbrio do atual paradigma econômico, mas de seus fundamentos. Na tentativa de adequar os modelos empresariais da atualidade aos desafios da sustentabilidade, surgem as empresas com propósito, como as Empresas B. O presente estudo tem como objetivo analisar as empresas com propósito, verificando como podem contribuir para o surgimento de novas economias socioambientalmente inclusivas. Como forma de qualificar essas experiências, a Matriz da ecossocioeconomia das organizações apresenta-se como uma ferramenta teórico-metodológica adequada para repensar os atuais modelos de gestão empresarial que ponderam as consequências sociais e custos ambientais nas ações econômicas. Para isso, foi realizada uma pesquisa exploratória-descritiva de cunho qualitativo, utilizando como métodos a pesquisa bibliográfica-documental e análise de conteúdo. Tem-se como recorte de estudo 22 empresas com propósito socioambiental do movimento B no Brasil, empresas que, sem deixar de agir pela lógica do mercado, incorporam os impactos sociais e ambientais em seu modelo de negócios.
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: The intense debate about the socioenvironmental crisis has mobilized increasing attention throughout the world. This is because it is not only an ecological calamity or an imbalance of the current economic paradigm, but of its foundations. In an attempt to adapt today's business models to the challenges of sustainability, companies arise with purpose, such as companies B. The present study aims to analyze the companies with purpose, verifying how they can contribute to the The emergence of new socio-environmentally inclusive economies. As a way to qualify these experiences, the ecosocioeconomies matrix of organizations presents itself as a theoretical-methodological framework suitable for rethinking the current business management that considering the social consequences and environmental costs in the Economic actions. For this, an exploratory-descriptive research of qualitative nature was performed, using as methods the bibliographic-documental research and content analysis. The study has 22 companies with socio-environmental purpose of the B movement in Brazil, companies that, without fail to act on the market logic, incorporate the social and environmental impacts in their business model.

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: Basing natural capital for the purpose of its measurement becomes the main objective of this work. This is justified since in accounting, the measurement of environmental resources with a purely economic view has its limitations, causing the search for other areas of study, such as social and ecological. That is, to bring to the field of study of environmental variables bases elaborated through interdisciplinary studies. For accounting, realizing this rationale means meeting the responsibility highlighted in the Theory of Measurement by addressing natural capital with a not only quantitative (monetary) but also qualitative (characteristics of ecosystem resources used by man) vision. It aims to contribute to this theory and the social perspective of accounting science. It thus brings information to users based on biological, social and ecological characteristics, among others, which are relevant to the analysis of ecosystem services (services provided by nature) over time. Society will then be able to observe the limitations on the use of ecosystem services in order to address what policies can be undertaken to work on the conservation, restoration or preservation of natural capital, an item present in such service

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: The tourism sector was significantly impacted in the most serious periods of the Covid-19 pandemic. Not differently, tourism in the Pantanal was also aggravated by the environmental crisis with fires in the dry periods that coincide with the local high season. The thesis "Tourism and the Pantanal of Mato Grosso with its economic, social and environmental relations" has the general objective of analyzing the socioeconomic and environmental impacts of tourism in the Pantanal of Mato Grosso. As a result of this subject, examine whether the tourist inns in the town Poconé, in the Pantanal of Mato Grosso, present elements of transience in relation to the characteristics of business organizations, towards hybrid organizations that can combine elements of logic established in their practices for a new organizational form, and what is the relationship of this with the theories of eco-socioeconomics. For systematization purposes, the thesis was organized into four scientific papers, each one with its specific methodology. The first one, entitled "Tourism and the Pantanal: relations with the objectives of sustainable development", addresses the relations between tourism and the Pantanal, relating them to the objectives of sustainable development, and it aims to carry out a systematic review of the literature on tourism in the Pantanal biome, with a time frame between the year 2000 and the year 2021, adding the most important themes and making an interface with the 17 Sustainable Development Goals (SDGs) and the three dimensions of sustainable development: economic, social and environmental. Data were collected from the Coordination for the Improvement of Higher Education Personnel journals. The 56 surveys? abstracts were analyzed using the IRaMuTeQ software. The result shows that the Pantanal and tourism have interfaces with the SDGs, partially enabling the economic, social, and environmental dimensions of the SDGs. However, the Pantanal biome needs first investment and publi
